page.title: 06Farm Animals in Rathmell NW
page.content: There are two main groups of stock: the ones away from the farmhouse and the ones close to it. Away from the farmhouse are{sheep which make up 66% of the total stock and cows which make up 30%. The cows are split very evenly into{milk cows for dairy produce and{cattle for beef. The sheep live furthest from the farmhouse on the higher ground, as do the cattle, but the milk cows are closer to the farm for milking. It is these animals that provide the farmer's livelihood: wool, meat, milk and sale of stock for breeding. Around the farmhouse there may be some{hens}and{geese}and a few{pigs. Sometimes{horses}are kept but are mainly for riding. With the large number of sheep,{sheepdogs}are needed and they will live near the farmhouse.
